title: Second Trailer for 'Culpa Tuya' - Spanish Romantic Thriller 'Your Fault'
description: "You don't trust me, and I don't trust you!" Prime Video has debuted the second official trailer for the next romantic thriller from Spain called Your Fault, a sequel to My Fault from 2023. Ready to debut steaming streaming later this month - available on Prime Video worldwide. Culpa Tuya (the Spanish title) is a follow-up to My Fault featuring the same cast and same filmmaker, continuing with more romantic turbulence as they try to keep their love strong. The first film is also known by the term Culpables. Despite their parents' efforts to separate them, Noah & Nick's love seems unbreakable. However, work & college open their lives to new relationships. "When so many people are out to destroy a love story, can it really end well?" Only in the movies is their a good answer - though not always. Culpa Tuya brings back Nicole Wallace and Gabriel Guevara as Noah & Nick, with Marta Hazas, Iván Sánchez, Victor Varona, and Eva Ruiz. Along with Goya Toledo, Gabriela Andrada, Álex Béjar, Javier Morgade, and Felipe Londoño. This looks like Spain's 50 Shades of Grey mixed with Fast & Furious this time - adding in some car racing because why […]
author: Alex Billington
excerpt: "You don't trust me, and I don't trust you!" Prime Video has debuted the second official trailer for the next romantic thriller from Spain called Your Fault, a sequel to My Fault from 2023. text: TRAILERS by December 8, 2024Source: YouTube "You don't trust me, and I don't trust you!" Prime Video has debuted the second official trailer for the next romantic thriller from Spain called Your Fault, a sequel to My Fault from 2023. Ready to debut steaming streaming later this month - available on Prime Video worldwide. Culpa Tuya (the Spanish title) is a follow-up to My Fault featuring the same cast and same filmmaker, continuing with more romantic turbulence as they try to keep their love strong. The first film is also known by the term Culpables. Despite their parents' efforts to separate them, Noah & Nick's love seems unbreakable. However, work & college open their lives to new relationships. "When so many people are out to destroy a love story, can it really end well?" Only in the movies is their a good answer - though not always. Culpa Tuya brings back Nicole Wallace and Gabriel Guevara as Noah & Nick, with Marta Hazas, Iván Sánchez, Victor Varona, and Eva Ruiz. Along with Goya Toledo, Gabriela Andrada, Álex Béjar, Javier Morgade, and Felipe Londoño. This looks like Spain's 50 Shades of Grey mixed with Fast & Furious this time - adding in some car racing because why not. Here's the second official trailer for Domingo González's film Your Fault, direct from PV's YouTube: You can also rewatch the teaser trailer for Domingo González's Your Fault right here, for the first look. The love between Noah & Nick (Nicole Wallace & Gabriel Guevara returning again) seems unbreakable, despite the manoeuvres of their parents to break them up. But his job and her entry into college open their lives to new relationships. The appearance of a revenge-seeking ex-girlfriend as well as Nick's mother with unclear intentions will shake the foundations not only of their relationship, but of the Leister family itself. When so many people are out to destroy a love story, can it really end well? Your Fault, also known as Culpa Tuya in Spanish, is once again written and directed by Spanish filmmaker Domingo González, director of the first film My Fault previously, plus a few shorts and TV work. Produced by Pokeepsie Films, Álex de la Iglesia, & Carolina Bang. Amazon will debut Culpa Tuya (Your Fault) streaming on Prime Video worldwide starting on December 27th, 2024 during the holiday season later this year. Anyone into this? Find more posts in: Streaming, To Watch, Trailer prev next
html:
TRAILERS

by
December 8, 2024
Source: YouTube

"You don't trust me, and I don't trust you!" Prime Video has debuted the second official trailer for the next romantic thriller from Spain called Your Fault, a sequel to My Fault from 2023. Ready to debut steaming streaming later this month - available on Prime Video worldwide. Culpa Tuya (the Spanish title) is a follow-up to My Fault featuring the same cast and same filmmaker, continuing with more romantic turbulence as they try to keep their love strong. The first film is also known by the term Culpables. Despite their parents' efforts to separate them, Noah & Nick's love seems unbreakable. However, work & college open their lives to new relationships. "When so many people are out to destroy a love story, can it really end well?" Only in the movies is their a good answer - though not always. Culpa Tuya brings back Nicole Wallace and Gabriel Guevara as Noah & Nick, with Marta Hazas, Iván Sánchez, Victor Varona, and Eva Ruiz. Along with Goya Toledo, Gabriela Andrada, Álex Béjar, Javier Morgade, and Felipe Londoño. This looks like Spain's 50 Shades of Grey mixed with Fast & Furious this time - adding in some car racing because why not.

Here's the second official trailer for Domingo González's film Your Fault, direct from PV's YouTube:

You can also rewatch the teaser trailer for Domingo González's Your Fault right here, for the first look.

The love between Noah & Nick (Nicole Wallace & Gabriel Guevara returning again) seems unbreakable, despite the manoeuvres of their parents to break them up. But his job and her entry into college open their lives to new relationships. The appearance of a revenge-seeking ex-girlfriend as well as Nick's mother with unclear intentions will shake the foundations not only of their relationship, but of the Leister family itself. When so many people are out to destroy a love story, can it really end well? Your Fault, also known as Culpa Tuya in Spanish, is once again written and directed by Spanish filmmaker Domingo González, director of the first film My Fault previously, plus a few shorts and TV work. Produced by Pokeepsie Films, Álex de la Iglesia, & Carolina Bang. Amazon will debut Culpa Tuya (Your Fault) streaming on Prime Video worldwide starting on December 27th, 2024 during the holiday season later this year. Anyone into this?

Find more posts in: Streaming, To Watch, Trailer
